meanings.definition: The condition of being excessively salty.
meanings.sent1: The hypersalinity of the ocean water made it difficult for many sea creatures to survive.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the hypersalinity of the lake to understand its impact on the ecosystem.
meanings.sent3: The hypersalinity of the soup was so intense that even the crackers refused to swim in it.
meanings.sent4: The hypersalinity of the tears shed by the mermaid turned the sea around her into a salty ocean.
meanings.sent5: The hypersalinity of the pickle juice was so strong that it could almost be mistaken for seawater.

meanings.definition: A high level of salt concentration in a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The hypersalinity in the pond was causing concern among environmentalists.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen avoided the area due to the hypersalinity of the bay.
